title: Google's Pack Comes with Evil
body: <p>Even though I risk what little page rank my poor server has, I thought I'd spread the word anyway. I usually love Google and their products, however the new <a href="http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2006/01/make-your-computer-just-work.html">Google Pack</a> might be a step in the wrong direction. Here's a list of the evil that is included, ordered by disputable evil-ness:</p><dl><dt>Google Desktop</dt><dd>this is a marginally evil one. Depending on your hardware, it could slow down your computer significantly (for example, a slower computer with a small C drive and a large D drive filled with lots of indexable stuff, the metadata generated by the index will fill up the rest of the C drive). It has also had some security issues in the past, but who hasn't?</dd><dt>Mozilla <a title="Get Firefox!" href="http://www.spreadfirefox.com/?q=affiliates&amp;id=27747&amp;t=1">Firefox</a> <strong>with Google Toolbar</strong></dt><dd>I love my <a title="Get Firefox!" href="http://www.spreadfirefox.com/?q=affiliates&amp;id=27747&amp;t=1">Firefox</a>, but I can no longer seem to turn off my Google Toolbar :-(</dd><dt>Norton AntiVirus 2005 Special Edition</dt><dd>This one is just a 6-month trial. There are at least 2 non-evil apps: <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#antivir">AntiVir Personal Edition</a> and <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#avgfree">AVG Free Edition</a></dd><dt>Adobe Reader 7</dt><dd>I <strong title="HATE!">hate</strong> PDFs. (I'm not the <a href="http://www.useit.com/alertbox/20030714.html">only one</a>) A less-evil approach would be to include some non-Adobe/open source/freeware PDF reader (like <a href="http://www.foxitsoftware.com/pdf/rd_intro.php">Foxit</a> and/or <a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/pdfcreator/">PDFCreator</a>), but the only non-evil approach would be to not include anything and leave PDFs the F alone.</dd><dt>Real Player</dt><dd>C'mon, Real Player? What a POS! The only non-evil option for this one IMHO is the <a href="http://travis.servebeer.com/blog.net/articles/useful_software.aspx#klitecodecpack">K-Lite Mega Codec Pack</a></dd></dl><p>Ah well, there are many other apps included that make it worth a download (Google Earth, Trillian, et al). Also, if anyone wants to try out MSN's new beta Messenger let me know, I have one invite remaining.</p><p><strong>Update:</strong> it looks like <a href="http://www.hanselman.com/blog/PermaLink.aspx?guid=b93fd18e-82cd-4038-9a1b-d7ed224d46ad">I'm not the only one here either</a>.</p>
